lightningkmf wrote:BEST BUILD
Druid 24 Monk 6
Reason: I really don't like this build or the rp that goes with it..... I have to admit though. Dragon shape with this build is just unreal.. This build will allow you to destroy armies of enemy 30s. It really is that good.
This quote got me curious. Anyone care to elaborate on it? I play on Arelith so anything beyond level 30 is pointless, with the 3 consecutive level rule (the first three levels of every class you must take in a row).

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
It's impossible with this split, unfortunately, vanilla-wise that is. Dragon Shape requires WIS of 30.

The highest WIS possible is 29 (base 18 + 7 level-ups + 4 Grt WIS) and still have a druid feat available for DS. It could reach WIS 30 but only by sacrificing the last druid bonus feat for Grt WIS which sort of defeats the original premise of taking DS. The only way to reach DS within 30 levels is via CoT and even then all the epic feats will get sucked up by Grt WIS.

Of course, if there is some sort of custom race modification on Arelith with starting WIS ability higher than 18, that would be the only way.

Can you elaborate on this, and explain the differences between this and the Cleric-Monk combinations in contrast?

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Maximillian Kane wrote:

Druid 18 CoT 6 Monk 6 is IMO the best Arelith spread, some nice saves and many epic bonus feats to play with
Druid 20/CoT 4/Monk 6 also works and grants elder elemental shape and extra spell slots and caster levels at the cost of 1 feat. Another option is Druid 30, which may be good if pure class builds get special benefits.

Druid 20/CoT 4/Monk 6 also works and grants elder elemental shape and extra spell slots and caster levels at the cost of 1 feat. Another option is Druid 30, which may be good if pure class builds get special benefits.
That would be my second choice. I prefer an extra epic feat and +1 to saves to the very minor upgrades in a shape that I won`t use as much anyway

To elaborate more, CoT gives Great Wisdom, Monk gives Wisdom AC and attack progression which transfer to the shuift (so you can be a Dragon with 7 Attacks per round if you`re hasted, 6 otherwise). About the difference between Druid Monks and Cleric Monks is pretty much the difference between Druid and Cleric and how Monk complements each of these classes. Read both of my guides, on Druids and on Clerics and you should be able to figure it out.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Maximillian Kane wrote:
That would be my second choice. I prefer an extra epic feat and +1 to saves to the very minor upgrades in a shape that I won`t use as much anyway
Dragon is 3x/day and doesn't work well in tight places. It's nice to have a feasible alternative/backup IMO and elder shapes are a definite improvement of the elemental shape. Anyhow, one picks what he likes best
To elaborate more, CoT gives Great Wisdom, Monk gives Wisdom AC and attack progression which transfer to the shuift (so you can be a Dragon with 7 Attacks per round if you`re hasted, 6 otherwise)
Actually 6 and 5 since with those two split since you need two CoT bonus feats in epic.
About the difference between Druid Monks and Cleric Monks is pretty much the difference between Druid and Cleric and how Monk complements each of these classes. Read both of my guides, on Druids and on Clerics and you should be able to figure it out.
One difference is that druid has natural access to shapes where monk is basically required (either druid shapes or shifter ones) and hence monk is a natural fit, while cleric needs to be built to accommodate monk (not that it is that difficult, mind me ).
